text.text_translated: Earthquakes damage all structures, including bridges. But this kind of collapse is not common. It is rare, especially with modern bridges. Engineers learned how to design bridges in earthquake zones. They build on areas that are much more resistant to movement.

feedback.feedback:
FAIL: CEFR vocabulary compliance. Contains words beyond A2 level.
- earthquakes (level B1)
- damage (level B1)
- rare (level B1)
- collapse (level B2)
Suggestion: Replace these with A2-level words such as 'shake' for earthquakes, 'hurt' or 'break' for damage, 'not often' for rare, 'fall' for collapse. Ensure all vocabulary stays within A2.

best_attempt.text_translated: Earthquakes damage all structures, including bridges. But this kind of collapse is not common. It is rare, especially with modern bridges. Engineers learned how to design bridges in earthquake zones. They build on areas that are much more resistant to movement.
